Package model.infiniteodysseys

Class IOManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.infiniteodysseys.IOManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Manager
    public class IOManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements Manager
    An implementation of the Manager for Infinite Odysseys.

      • addParty

        public void addParty​(java.lang.String name,
                     Character... c)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                     java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Description copied from interface: Manager
        Adds a Party to this Manager with the given name. The Party is made up of the given Characters. If any of the given Characters are NOT in this Manager, they get added to this Manager.
        Specified by:
        addParty in interface Manager
        Parameters:
        name - the name to index the party as
        c - the characters to put into the party
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given String is null OR if the given String is whitespace OR if any of the characters are null.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there's a party in this manager with the given name

      • removeCharacter

        public void removeCharacter​(java.lang.String name)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                            java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Description copied from interface: Manager
        Removes the Character from this Manager whose name matches the given String. This method should also go through every Party where the character being removed appears in, and remove them. This means editing all of those Parties.

        So for example, if a Party, p1, contains characters c1, c2, c3; and another Party, p2, contains c2, c3, c4, c5, c6; and lastly p3, contains just c2. If c2 is removed, p1 becomes c1, c3; p2 becomes c3, c4, c5, c6, and p3 is removed since a Party cannot contain 0 Characters.

        In the case that a party is removed via this method, and said party was the active party, this method should set the active party to the first party this Manager has. If there are no parties after this method removes a party, the active party should be set to null.

        Specified by:
        removeCharacter in interface Manager
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the character to remove
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given String is null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the manager has no characters

      • removeParty

        public void removeParty​(java.lang.String name)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                        java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Description copied from interface: Manager
        Removes the Party from this Manager whose name matches the given String. This method should NOT remove the Characters from the manager.

        If the party that was removed was the active party, this method should set the active party to the first party this Manager has. If there are no parties after this method removes a party, the active party should be set to null.

        Specified by:
        removeParty in interface Manager
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the party to remove
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given String is null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the manager has no parties
